code.value: Not Modified: There was no new data to return.
Bad Request: The request was invalid. An accompanying error message will explain why. This is the status code will be returned during rate limiting.
Unauthorized: Authentication credentials were missing or incorrect.
Forbidden: The request is understood, but it has been refused. An accompanying error message will explain why. This code is used when requests are being denied due to update limits.
Not Found: The URI requested is invalid or the resource requested, such as a user, does not exists.
Internal Server Error: Something is broken.

method.name: GET
method.notes: Gets the nearby points from a given geohash. Returns records in a given geohash for the given layer. By nature, a geohash is a bounding box, which means that no radius or center point is needed. Searching by a simple geohash is the fastest way to do a nearby query with the API.

method.name: GET
method.notes: Search the API using a given latitude and longitude. The default radius is 1 kilometer and 25 records are returned by default. Specifying start and end in the request will search the API within a given time interval. Specifying start and end in the request will search the API within a given time interval. To make use of our time based index, the difference between start and end must not be greater than 60 minutes.

method.name: GET
method.notes: Does a reverse geocode lookup, which converts the given latitude and longitude into a human readable point with address, street, city, state, and county depending on where the person is currently located. NOTE: The reverse geocoder only works for coordinates in the US currently.

method.name: GET
method.notes: Does a "pushpin" query through a series of polygon layers and identifies the "cone" of administrative and other boundaries in which the point lies. Returns a list of features containing id, name, abbr, type and bounds fields.

method.name: GET
method.notes: Queries a series of polygon layers and identifies the "cone" of administrative and other boundaries that overlap with the given bounding box. The arguments are expected in units of latitude and longitude. The results are returned in the same form as the contains query.

method.name: GET
method.notes: Returns a feature object from the SimpleGeo gazetteer, as above, along with the geometry of the feature in GeoJSON format in the geometry field. The id parameter to this method should given in the same form as returned by the contains method above.

method.name: GET
method.notes: Returns the Skyhook SpotRank data for the requested location on a given day and hour. dayname is one of: mon, tue, wed, thu, fri, sat, or sun. hour is between 0-23.

method.name: GET
method.notes: Returns the Skyhook SpotRank data for the requested location on a given day. dayname is one of: mon, tue, wed, thu, fri, sat, or sun.
